title: Augusta County: John Scott to Samuel Hunt, March 13, 1866
summary: Scott laments the removal of William L. Coan from his position with the AMA in Virginia, arguing that Coan was a necessary and exceedingly helpful agent of the Association in the area. Commenting on financial troubles, Scott argues that it might be possible for teachers to board with "colored families" as a means to cut down on costs.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Race Relations, Women, Economy, American Civil War
